2. two particles, p and q, have masses 2m and 3m respectively.  they are moving towards 
each other in opposite directions on a smooth horizontal plane when they collide directly. 
immediately before they collide the speed of p is 4u and the speed of q is 3u.  as a result 
of the collision, q has its direction of motion reversed and is moving with speed u.
 
(a) find the speed of p immediately after the collision.
(3)
 
(b) state whether or not the direction of motion of p has been reversed by the collision. 
(1)
 
(c) find the magnitude of the impulse exerted on p by q in the collision.
(3)

3. a plank ab has length 6m and mass 30kg. the point c is on the plank with cb = 2m.  
the plank rests in equilibrium in a horizontal position on supports at a and c.  two 
people, each of mass 75kg, stand on the plank.  one person stands at the point p of the 
plank, where ap = x metres, and the other person stands at the point q of the plank, where  
aq = 2x metres.  the plank remains horizontal and in equilibrium with the magnitude of 
the reaction at c five times the magnitude of the reaction at a.  the plank is modelled as 
a uniform rod and each person is modelled as a particle.
 
(a) find the value of x.
(7)
 
(b) state two ways in which you have used the assumptions made in modelling the plank 
as a uniform rod. 
(2)
